select the account you wish to sign data: select the account you wish to sign data with
The account that signed the input: The account that signed the input
The blake2b 256-bit hash of the actual i: The blake2b 256-bit hash of the actual input data.
You need to unlock this account to be ab: You need to unlock this account to be able to sign data.
The accounts password specified at the c: The account's password specified at the creation of this account.
Detection on the input string to determi: Detection on the input string to determine if it is hex or non-hex.
The signature as by the account being ch: The signature as by the account being checked, supplied as a hex-formatted string.
Cryptography used to create this signatu: Cryptography used to create this signature. It is auto-detected on valid signatures.
The input data to hash This can be eithe: The input data to hash. This can be either specified as a hex value (0x-prefix) or as a string.
The input data to sign This can be eithe: The input data to sign. This can be either specified as a hex value (0x-prefix) or as a string.
The data that was signed This is used in: The data that was signed. This is used in combination with the signature for the verification. It can either be hex or a string.
You are about to unlock your account to: You are about to unlock your account to allow for the signing of messages Once active the signature will be generated based on the content provided
The resulting signature of the input dat: The resulting signature of the input data, as done with the crypto algorithm from the account. (This could be non-deterministic for some types such as sr25519).
